intro: Barleria dolomiticola, commonly known as the dolomitic barleria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or violet, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained, calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
